Sentencas: A direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell (DC-SOFC) is an all-solid-state device that can directly convert the chemical energy of carbon into electricity with high efficiency and low pollution.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: This study assesses the feasibility of using carbon-rich biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse, respectively, as the fuels of DC-SOFCs.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: The chars are characterized using thermo-gravimetric analysis (TGA), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy dispersive spectrometer (EDS), X-ray diffraction (XRD), Raman spectroscopy, and tapping apparatus.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: Different quantities of K, Si, S, Ca, Mg, and Fe are found from the chars.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: It turns out that the output performances of the DC-SOFCs are closely related to the characteristics of the chars used.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: The peak power densities of 187 and 204 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C are achieved by the cells with wheat straw char and corn cob char, whereas the cell with bagasse char performs the highest output performance of 260 mW cm(-2).
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: Cells with 0.5 g chars of wheat straw, corn cob, and bagasse discharge at a constant current density of 140 mA cm(-2), and it lasts for 15 h, 24 h and 22 h, respectively.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: The Boudouard reaction reactivity is assessed by analyzing the emitted gas compositions of DC-SOFCs discharging at a constant current density of 500 mA cm(-2) via gas chromatography (GC).
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse

Sentencas: It turns out that the higher CO concentration representing the faster Boudouard reaction on the fuel.
Titulo: A comparative investigation on direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells operated with fuels of biochar derived from wheat straw, corncob, and bagasse
